page.title: 07Job Changes:Chinnor etc
page.content: There is little left of the thriving chair industry that once existed in Chinnor because of the proximity of the Chiltern beech woods, although there is one small factory which still sends chairs to High Wycombe. Both this and the Cement Works lie just outside our block and provide comparatively few jobs for the people in the area with which we are concerned. A straw-poll conducted by us in Sydenham (Pop.300 approx.) resulted as follows: Pilot-3; Aeronautical Engineer-2; Computer Trade-2; Antique Dealing-1; Furniture Restoring-1; Historian-2; School teacher-2; Car Auctioneer-1; Car Mechanic-1; Accountant-1; Farmer-8; Farmworker-8; Publican-2; Needlewoman-1; Silk Blouse Maker-1. In Chinnor's new estates white-collar occupations predominate.
